responsibilities: Work as part of a team to support late-stage assay development by performing mass spectrometry to characterize molecules, degradation pathways, and define critical quality attributes in a phase-appropriate context.
Contribute to analytical method development and qualification to support protein characterization activities.
Support comparability and stability studies by mass spectrometry.
Operate, maintain, and troubleshoot Waters and Bruker QTOFs and Thermo Orbitrap mass spectrometers.
Work on moderately complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires evaluation of intangible variables requiring regular use of intelligence, logic, ingenuity, and creativity.
Collaborate with junior and senior team members to advance the development of state-of-the-art techniques to characterize substances, assays, and tools.
Represent the Structure Characterization group in cross-functional project teams.
Participate in technology transfer of assays from analytical development to QC and external CRO/CMOs.

Conduct scientific research for the development of drug candidates or research support of marketed drugs.
Advise project teams on the planning and execution of laboratory experiments, considering economic, regulatory, and safety factors.
Present results of work, interpret data, and draw conclusions regarding presented material and nature of work.

qualifications: Strong knowledge in mass spectrometry, experimental design, and assay development.

Familiarity with peptide mapping by LC-MS/MS, intact mass analysis, MS/MS for protein and carbohydrate structural elucidation/quantification, kinetic analyses, ultra-performance chromatography, and proteolytic/chemical processing.
Knowledge of ICH guidelines and GMP is a plus.
Expertise in mass spectrometry analysis software (Protein Metrics, Thermo BioPharma Finder, and Skyline) and data analysis/visualization tools (Python, R, JMP, and Spotfire).
Excellent communication skills (both verbal and technical) and interpersonal skills.
Ability to participate in highly effective teams.
Ability to think critically and creatively and work independently.
Ability to work in a matrixed environment and effectively communicate ideas, assay results, and issues.
